prompt: Which observation best supports the idea that continents were once joined?

options.text: Identical fossils found on continents now separated by oceans.
options.feedback: Matching fossils across oceans are classic evidence of past connection.

prompt: Why do most earthquakes and volcanoes occur along plate boundaries?

options.text: Plates interact (collide, slide, or spread) at boundaries, releasing energy.
options.feedback: Movement and interaction at boundaries generate quakes and volcanoes.

options.text: Boundaries are the coldest parts of plates.

prompt: What does the movement of tectonic plates float on?

options.text: The semi-fluid asthenosphere beneath the lithosphere.
options.feedback: Plates ride on the softer asthenosphere layer.
